00032 integer abs(const integer& n) {
00033     return (n < 0 ? -n : n);

00042 integer negate(const integer& n) {
00043     n._throw_if_nan();
00044 
00045     integer nn(n);
00046     nn._make_unique();
00047     nn._get_data()->negate();
00048     return nn;
00049 }

00057 integer add(const integer& n1, const integer& n2) {
00058     int sign1=n1.sign(), sign2=n2.sign();
00059     if (sign1 != sign2) {
00060         if (sign1==0) return n2;
00061         else if (sign2==0) return n1;
00062         else return subtract(n1, -n2);
00063     } else {
00064         const data_t *n1data=n1._get_data(), *n2data=n2._get_data();
00065         if (n1data->mLength < n2data->mLength) std::swap(n1data, n2data);
00066 
00067         integer r;
00068         data_t *rdata=r._get_data();
00069         rdata->copy(n1data, 1);
00070         rdata->add(*n2data);
00071         return r;
00072     }
00073 }
00074 
00081 integer subtract(const integer& n1, const integer& n2) {
00082     int sign1=n1.sign(), sign2=n2.sign();
00083     if (sign1 != sign2) {
00084         if (sign1 == 0) return -n2;
00085         else if (sign2 == 0) return n1;
00086         else return add(n1, -n2);
00087     } else {
00088         bool invert=(sign1 == (n1 < n2 ? 1 : -1));
00089         const data_t *n1data=n1._get_data(), *n2data=n2._get_data();
00090         if (invert) std::swap(n1data, n2data);
00091 
00092         integer r;
00093         data_t *rdata=r._get_data();
00094         rdata->copy(n1data);
00095         rdata->subtract(*n2data);
00096         return (invert ? -r : r);
00097     }
00098 }

00110 integer multiply(const integer& n, const integer& by) {
00111     int nsign=n.sign(), bysign=by.sign();
00112     if (nsign==0 || bysign==0) return integer::zero();
00113 
00114     const data_t *ndata=n._get_data(), *bydata=by._get_data();
00115     if (ndata == bydata) return sqr(n);
00116 
00117     // In multiplication, we know that the answer will be less than or equal to
00118     // the sum of the lengths of the operands.
00119     integer answer;
00120     data_t *answerdata=answer._get_data();
00121     answerdata->alloc(ndata->mLength + bydata->mLength);
00122 
00123     // Now multiply the digits, starting at the least-significant digit.
00124     const digit_t *d1 = ndata->digits, *d1e = d1 + ndata->mLength;
00125     const digit_t *d2e = bydata->digits + bydata->mLength;
00126     for (int digit1=0; d1<d1e; ++digit1, ++d1) {
00127         const digit_t *d2=bydata->digits;
00128         for (int digit2=0; d2<d2e; ++digit2, ++d2) {
00129             // First multiply the two digits
00130             doubledigit_t t=doubledigit_t(*d1) * *d2;
00131 
00132             // Now add the result to the answer.
00133             int carry=0;
00134             digit_t *a = answerdata->digits + digit1 + digit2;
00135             doubledigit_t addt=doubledigit_t(*a) + (t & digit_mask);
00136             if (addt >= digit_overflowbit) carry=1;
00137             *a++=static_cast<digit_t>(addt);
00138 
00139             addt=*a + ((t >> bits_per_digit) & digit_mask) + carry;
00140             if (addt >= digit_overflowbit) carry=1; else carry=0;
00141             *a++=static_cast<digit_t>(addt);
00142 
00143             while (carry) {
00144                 addt=*a+1;
00145                 *a++ = static_cast<digit_t>(addt);
00146                 if (addt < digit_overflowbit) break;
00147             }
00148         }
00149     }
00150 
00151     answer._set_negative(nsign != bysign);
00152     answer._get_data()->skipLeadingZeros();
00153     return answer;
00154 }

00158 std::pair<integer, integer> divideBySingleDigit(const integer& d1, digit_t d2) {
00159     const data_t *d1data=d1._get_data();
00160 
00161     integer quotient, remainder;
00162     data_t *qdata=quotient._get_data(), *rdata=remainder._get_data();
00163     qdata->alloc(d1data->mLength);
00164     rdata->alloc(1);
00165 
00166     doubledigit_t a=0;
00167     const doubledigit_t lomask(digit_mask);
00168     const doubledigit_t himask(doubledigit_t(digit_mask) << bits_per_digit);
00169 
00170     int m = int(d1data->mLength) - 1;
00171     const digit_t *d1p=d1data->digits+m;
00172     digit_t *qp=qdata->digits+m;
00173     for (int i = m; i >= 0; --i, --d1p, --qp) {
00174         a = (a & ~lomask) | *d1p;
00175         *qp = static_cast<digit_t>(a / d2);
00176         a = (a & ~himask) | ((a % d2) << bits_per_digit);
00177     }
00178     rdata->digits[0] = static_cast<digit_t>((a & himask) >>
00179         bits_per_digit);
00180 
00181     qdata->skipLeadingZeros();
00182     rdata->skipLeadingZeros();
00183     return std::make_pair(quotient, remainder);
00184 }
00185 
00186 std::pair<integer, integer> subDivide(integer d1, integer d2) {
00187     const digit_t *byDigits = d2._get_data()->digits;
00188 
00189     // The normalization step
00190     digit_t d = static_cast<digit_t>(digit_overflowbit /
00191         (doubledigit_t(byDigits[d2._get_length()-1])+1));
00192     if (d > 1) {
00193         d1 *= d;
00194         d2 *= d;
00195 
00196         // Gotta reset this
00197         byDigits = d2._get_data()->digits;
00198     }
00199     assert(d2._get_digit(d2._get_length()-1) >= digit_overflowbit / 2);
00200 
00201     integer quotient, r(d1);
00202     data_t *qdata=quotient._get_data();
00203 
00204     size_t n=d2._get_length(), m=d1._get_length() - n;
00205     size_t i=m+n, j=m;
00206     qdata->alloc(j+1);
00207 
00208     r._make_unique();
00209     do {
00210         doubledigit_t ri=(doubledigit_t(r._get_digit(i, true))
00211             << bits_per_digit) + r._get_digit(i-1, true);
00212         doubledigit_t q=(std::min<doubledigit_t>)(ri / byDigits[n-1], digit_mask);
00213 
00214         while (1) {
00215             // We need three digits here, a doubledigit_t won't suffice.
00216             doubledigit_t r2a=ri - (q * byDigits[n-1]);
00217             integer r2=(integer(r2a) << bits_per_digit) + r._get_digit(i-2);
00218             if (byDigits[n-2] * q <= r2) break;
00219             --q;
00220         }
00221 
00222         integer bq=d2*q;
00223         if (r < bq) { --q; bq -= d2; }
00224 
00225         integer rtemp((r >> (bits_per_digit * (i-n))) - bq);
00226         data_t *rdata=r._get_data();
00227 
00228         digit_t *rdigits=rdata->digits;
00229 
00230         for (size_t x=0; x<=n && i-n+x < rdata->mLength; ++x)
00231             rdigits[i-n+x]=rtemp._get_digit(x, true);
00232         rdata->skipLeadingZeros();
00233 
00234         qdata->digits[j--]=digit_t(q);
00235     } while (--i >= n);
00236 
00237     qdata->skipLeadingZeros();
00238 
00239     if (d > 1) {
00240         // Denormalization step. This requires a division by a single digit_t.
00241         integer remainder=divideBySingleDigit(r, d).first;
00242         return std::make_pair(quotient, remainder);
00243     } else {
00244         return std::make_pair(quotient, r);
00245     }
00246 }

00258 integer divide(const integer& dividend, const integer& divisor) {
00259     return divide_r(dividend, divisor).first;
00260 }
00261 
00276 std::pair<integer, integer> divide_r(const integer& d1, const
00277     integer& d2)
00278 {
00279     int sign1=d1.sign(), sign2=d2.sign();
00280     if (sign2==0) {
00281         if (exceptions_allowed()) throw divide_by_zero();
00282         else return std::make_pair(integer(not_a_number()), integer(not_a_number()));
00283     }
00284 
00285     int comp=compare(d1, d2, true);
00286     if (comp<0) {
00287         return std::make_pair(integer::zero(), d1);
00288     } else if (comp==0) {
00289         return std::make_pair(sign1 != sign2 ? integer::one() : integer(-1),
00290             integer::zero());
00291     }
00292 
00293     if (sign1 < 0 && sign2 < 0) {
00294         std::pair<integer, integer> a=subDivide(-d1, -d2);
00295         a.second._set_negative(true);
00296         return a;
00297     } else if (sign1 < 0) {
00298         std::pair<integer, integer> a=subDivide(-d1, d2);
00299         a.first._set_negative(true);
00300         a.second._set_negative(true);
00301         return a;
00302     } else if (sign2 < 0) {
00303         std::pair<integer, integer> a=subDivide(d1, -d2);
00304         a.first._set_negative(true);
00305         return a;
00306     };
00307 
00308     if (d2._get_data()->mLength == 1) {
00309         return divideBySingleDigit(d1, d2._get_data()->digits[0]);
00310     } else {
00311         return subDivide(d1, d2);
00312     }
00313 }
